content.subject: Virtual observatory
TAP_SCHEMA
content.description:
The global TAP schema collects information on tables and columns from known TAP servers. This facilitates locating queriable data by physics (via UCD) or keywords (via description).
Note that this shouldn't really be necessary as all information present here should be exposed through Registry records. However, in reality data providers currently are much more liable to give column metadata in their tap_schema than in their Registry records. Hence, for the time being, we maintain this service by harvesting tap_schemas about monthly.

schema.name: glots
schema.title: GloTS, the Global TAP Schema
schema.description:
The global TAP schema collects information on tables and columns from known TAP servers. This facilitates locating queriable data by physics (via UCD) or keywords (via description).
Note that this shouldn't really be necessary as all information present here should be exposed through Registry records. However, in reality data providers currently are much more liable to give column metadata in their tap_schema than in their Registry records. Hence, for the time being, we maintain this service by harvesting tap_schemas about monthly.

ri:Resource.title: Introduction to Simulation Databases - Density Fields and Dark Matter Halos

content.subject: Virtual observatory
Tutorials
Simulations
Cosmology
content.description: This tutorial was created for a physics teacher workshop (~ high school level). It shows how to extract density fields and information on dark matter halos from the CosmoSim database using SQL queries. It is optimized for brevity.

content.subject: Registry
content.description:
Tables containing the information in the IVOA registry. To query these tables, use `our TAP service`_.
For more information and example queries, see the `RegTAP specification`_.
.. _our TAP service: /__system__/tap/run/info .. _RegTAP specification: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/RegTAP/

schema.name: rr
schema.title: The GAVO Relational VO Registy
schema.description:
Tables containing the information in the IVOA registry. To query these tables, use `our TAP service`_.
For more information and example queries, see the `RegTAP specification`_.
.. _our TAP service: /__system__/tap/run/info .. _RegTAP specification: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/RegTAP/

table.name: rr.capability
table.description: Pieces of behaviour of a resource.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: cap_index
column.description: An arbitrary identifier of this capability within the resource.

column.name: cap_type
column.description: The type of capability covered here.

column.name: cap_description
column.description: A human-readable description of what this capability provides as part of the over-all service.

column.name: standard_id
column.description: A URI for a standard this capability conforms to.

table.name: rr.interface
table.description: Information on access modes of a capability.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: cap_index
column.description: The index of the parent capability.

column.name: intf_index
column.description: An arbitrary identifier for the interfaces of a resource.

column.name: intf_type
column.description: The type of the interface (vr:webbrowser, vs:paramhttp, etc).

column.name: intf_role
column.description: An identifier for the role the interface plays in the particular capability. If the value is equal to "std" or begins with "std:", then the interface refers to a standard interface defined by the standard referred to by the capability's standardID attribute.

column.name: std_version
column.description: The version of a standard interface specification that this interface complies with. When the interface is provided in the context of a Capability element, then the standard being refered to is the one identified by the Capability's standardID element.

column.name: query_type
column.description: Hash-joined list of expected HTTP method (get or post) supported by the service.

column.name: result_type
column.description: The MIME type of a document returned in the HTTP response.

column.name: wsdl_url
column.description: The location of the WSDL that describes this Web Service. If NULL, the location can be assumed to be the accessURL with '?wsdl' appended.

column.name: url_use
column.description: A flag indicating whether this should be interpreted as a base URL ('base'), a full URL ('full'), or a URL to a directory that will produce a listing of files ('dir').

column.name: access_url
column.description: The URL at which the interface is found.

table.name: rr.res_role
table.description: Entities, i.e., persons or organizations, operating on resources: creators, contacts, publishers, contributors.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: role_name
column.description: The real-world name or title of a person or organization.

column.name: role_ivoid
column.description: An IVOA identifier of a person or organization.

column.name: street_address
column.description: A mailing address for a person or organization.

column.name: email
column.description: An email address the entity can be reached at.

column.name: telephone
column.description: A telephone number the entity can be reached at.

column.name: logo
column.description: URL pointing to a graphical logo, which may be used to help identify the entity.

column.name: base_role
column.description: The role played by this entity; this is one of contact, publisher, and creator.

table.name: rr.resource
table.description: The resources, i.e., services, data collections, organizations, etc., present in this registry.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: Unambiguous reference to the resource conforming to the IVOA standard for identifiers.

column.name: res_type
column.description: Resource type (something like vs:datacollection, vs:catalogservice, etc).

column.name: created
column.description: The UTC date and time this resource metadata description was created. This timestamp must not be in the future. This time is not required to be accurate; it should be at least accurate to the day. Any insignificant time fields should be set to zero.

column.name: short_name
column.description: A short name or abbreviation given to something. This name will be used where brief annotations for the resource name are required. Applications may use it to refer to the resource in a compact display. One word or a few letters is recommended. No more than sixteen characters are allowed.

column.name: res_title
column.description: The full name given to the resource.

column.name: updated
column.description: The UTC date this resource metadata description was last updated. This timestamp must not be in the future. This time is not required to be accurate; it should be at least accurate to the day. Any insignificant time fields should be set to zero.

column.name: content_level
column.description: A hash-separated list of content levels specifying the intended audience.

column.name: res_description
column.description: An account of the nature of the resource.

column.name: reference_url
column.description: URL pointing to a human-readable document describing this resource.

column.name: creator_seq
column.description: The creator(s) of the resource in the order given by the resource record author, separated by semicolons.

column.name: content_type
column.description: A hash-separated list of natures or genres of the content of the resource.

column.name: source_format
column.description: The format of source_value. Recognized values include "bibcode", referring to a standard astronomical bibcode (http://cdsweb.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/refcode.html).

column.name: source_value
column.description: A bibliographic reference from which the present resource is derived or extracted.

column.name: res_version
column.description: Label associated with creation or availablilty of a version of a resource.

column.name: region_of_regard
column.description: A single numeric value representing the angle, given in decimal degrees, by which a positional query against this resource should be "blurred" in order to get an appropriate match.

column.name: waveband
column.description: A hash-separated list of regions of the electro-magnetic spectrum that the resource's spectral coverage overlaps with.

column.name: rights
column.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource (multiple values are separated by hashes).

column.name: harvested_from
column.description: IVORN of the registry this record came from.

table.name: rr.relationship
table.description: Relationships between resources, e.g., mirroring, derivation, but also providing access to data within a resource.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: relationship_type
column.description: The named type of relationship; this can be mirror-of, service-for, served-by, derived-from, related-to.

column.name: related_id
column.description: The IVOA identifier for the resource referred to.

column.name: related_name
column.description: The name of resource that this resource is related to.

table.name: rr.table_column
table.description: Metadata on columns of a resource's tables

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: table_index
column.description: Index of the table this column belongs to.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the column.

column.name: ucd
column.description: A unified content descriptor that describes the scientific content of the parameter.

column.name: unit
column.description: The unit associated with all values in the column.

column.name: utype
column.description: An identifier for a role in a data model that the data in this column represents.

column.name: std
column.description: If 1, the meaning and use of this parameter is reserved and defined by a standard model. If 0, it represents a database-specific parameter that effectively extends beyond the standard.

column.name: datatype
column.description: The type of the data contained in the column.

column.name: extended_schema
column.description: An identifier for the schema that the value given by the extended attribute is drawn from.

column.name: extended_type
column.description: A custom type for the values this column contains.

column.name: arraysize
column.description: The shape of the array that constitutes the value, e.g., 4, *, 4*, 5x4, or 5x*, as specified by VOTable.

column.name: delim
column.description: The string that is used to delimit elements of an array value when arraysize is not '1'.

column.name: type_system
column.description: The type system used, as a QName with a canonical prefix; this will ususally be one of vs:simpledatatype, vs:votabletype, and vs:taptype.

column.name: flag
column.description: Hash-separated keywords representing traits of the column. Recognized values include "indexed", "primary", and "nullable".

column.name: column_description
column.description: A free-text description of the column's contents.

table.name: rr.stc_spectral
table.description: The spectral coverage of resources, given as one or more intervals; the total coverage is (a subset of) the union of all intervals given for a resource. All spectral values are understood as given as wavelength in meters; they are supposed to express wavelength at the barycenter of the solar system (which means instrument values should be close enough to work).

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: spectral_start
column.description: Lower limit of a spectral interval covered by the resource.

column.name: spectral_end
column.description: Upper limit of a spectral interval covered by the resource.

table.name: rr.res_schema
table.description: Sets of tables related to resources.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: schema_index
column.description: An arbitrary identifier for the res_schema rows belonging to a resource.

column.name: schema_description
column.description: A free text description of the tableset explaining in general how all of the tables are related.

column.name: schema_name
column.description: A name for the set of tables.

column.name: schema_title
column.description: A descriptive, human-interpretable name for the table set.

column.name: schema_utype
column.description: An identifier for a concept in a data model that the data in this schema as a whole represent.

table.name: rr.stc_spatial
table.description: The spatial coverage of resources; the total coverage is (a subset of) the union of all regions given for a resource. All coordinates are in ICRS. There is no notion of how tight the given regions are.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: ra_min
column.description: A left edge of a bounding box on the sky the resource covers.

column.name: ra_max
column.description: An right edge of a bounding box on the sky the resource covers.

column.name: de_min
column.description: A lower edge of a bounding box on the sky the resource covers.

column.name: de_max
column.description: An upper edge of a bounding box on the sky the resource covers.

table.name: rr.imported
table.description: Administrative table: the files ingested together with the processing date. Due to incremental harvesting, multiple files may/will exist for a single resource.

column.name: path
column.description: Resdir-relative path of the input file.

column.name: processedon
column.description: Date and time of ingestion.

table.name: rr.validation
table.description: Validation levels for resources and capabilities.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: validated_by
column.description: The IVOA ID of the registry or organisation that assigned the validation level.

column.name: val_level
column.description: A numeric grade describing the quality of the resource description, when applicable, to be used to indicate the confidence an end-user can put in the resource as part of a VO application or research study.

column.name: cap_index
column.description: If non-NULL, the validation only refers to the capability referenced here.

table.name: rr.res_table
table.description: (Relational) tables that are part of schemata or resources.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: schema_index
column.description: Index of the schema this table belongs to, if it belongs to a schema (otherwise NULL).

column.name: table_description
column.description: A free-text description of the table's contents.

column.name: table_name
column.description: The fully qualified name of the table. This name should include all catalog or schema prefixes needed to distinguish it in a query.

column.name: table_index
column.description: An arbitrary identifier for the tables belonging to a resource.

column.name: table_title
column.description: A descriptive, human-interpretable name for the table.

column.name: table_type
column.description: A name for the role this table plays. Recognized values include "output", indicating this table is output from a query; "base_table", indicating a table whose records represent the main subjects of its schema; and "view", indicating that the table represents a useful combination or subset of other tables. Other values are allowed.

column.name: table_utype
column.description: An identifier for a concept in a data model that the data in this table as a whole represent.

table.name: rr.intf_param
table.description: Input parameters for services.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: intf_index
column.description: The index of the interface this parameter belongs to.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the parameter.

column.name: ucd
column.description: A unified content descriptor that describes the scientific content of the parameter.

column.name: unit
column.description: The unit associated with all values in the parameter.

column.name: utype
column.description: An identifier for a role in a data model that the data in this parameter represents.

column.name: std
column.description: If 1, the meaning and use of this parameter is reserved and defined by a standard model. If 0, it represents a database-specific parameter that effectively extends beyond the standard.

column.name: datatype
column.description: The type of the data contained in the parameter.

column.name: extended_schema
column.description: An identifier for the schema that the value given by the extended attribute is drawn from.

column.name: extended_type
column.description: A custom type for the values this parameter contains.

column.name: arraysize
column.description: The shape of the array that constitutes the value, e.g., 4, *, 4*, 5x4, or 5x*, as specified by VOTable.

column.name: delim
column.description: The string that is used to delimit elements of an array value when arraysize is not '1'.

column.name: param_use
column.description: An indication of whether this parameter is required to be provided for the application or service to work properly (one of required, optional, ignored, or NULL).

column.name: param_description
column.description: A free-text description of the parameter's contents.

table.name: rr.res_subject
table.description: Topics, object types, or other descriptive keywords about the resource.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: res_subject
column.description: Topics, object types, or other descriptive keywords about the resource.

table.name: rr.res_date
table.description: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource. This could be creation or update. The role column can be used to clarify.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: date_value
column.description: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

column.name: value_role
column.description: A string indicating what the date refers to, e.g., created, availability, updated.

table.name: rr.oairecs
table.description: Pre-rendered XML fragments for building OAI-PMH documents.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: rectimestamp
column.description: The date this resources's record was last updated.

column.name: oaixml
column.description: Pre-rendered XML for inclusion into OAI-PMH documents.

table.name: rr.res_detail
table.description: XPath-value pairs for members of resource or capability and their derivations that are less used and/or from VOResource extensions. The pairs refer to a resource if cap_index is NULL, to the referenced capability otherwise.

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: cap_index
column.description: The index of the parent capability; if NULL the xpath-value pair describes a member of the entire resource.

column.name: detail_xpath
column.description: The xpath of the data item.

column.name: detail_value
column.description: (Atomic) value of the member.

table.name: rr.stc_redshift

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: redshift_start
column.description: Lower limit of a redshift interval covered by the resource.

column.name: redshift_end
column.description: Upper limit of a redshift interval covered by the resource.

table.name: rr.stc_temporal

column.name: ivoid
column.description: The parent resource.

column.name: time_start
column.description: Lower limit of a time interval covered by the resource.

column.name: time_end
column.description: Upper limit of a time interval covered by the resource.

content.subject: Virtual observatory
Standards
TAP_SCHEMA
content.description: The Global TAP schema is an attempt at a simple way to present a union of all TAP_SCHEMA instances globally, where right now GloTS only contains tables and columns. It is primarily intended as a quick (and relatively dirty) way for data collection discovery until other means are ready.

key.name: tables-1.0
key.description: The data model (as used in TAPRegExt's dataModel element), consisting of glots.services, glots.tables, and glots.columns.

content.subject: Data retrieval
content.description:
This service delivers (most of) the datasets held at GAVO Data Center. In addition to the default (nonstandard) way of just appending accrefs to the get access URL, there is also a very simple datalink service here that, for each dataset, essentially just gives the dataset itself and possibly a preview. More advanced datalink services might be available.
Some datasets may be embargoed, in which case the access yields a 403. Credentials for individual files may be obtained by contacting the site operators.

param.name: ID
param.description: The pubisher DID of the dataset of interest

column.name: accref
column.description: Access key for the data

column.name: owner
column.description: Owner of the data

column.name: embargo
column.description: Date the data will become/became public

column.name: mime
column.description: MIME type of the file served

column.name: accesspath
column.description: Inputs-relative filesystem path to the file

column.name: sourcetable
column.description: Name of table containing metadata

column.name: preview
column.description: Location of a preview; this can be NULL if no preview is available, 'AUTO' if DaCHS is supposed to try and make its own previews based on MIME guessing, or a file name, or an URL.

column.name: datalink
column.description: A fully qualified URL of a datalink document for this dataset. This is to allow the global datalink service (sitting on the ~ resource and used by obscore) to forward datalink requests globally.

column.name: preview_mime
column.description: MIME type of a preview (if any)

creator.name: Rauch, T.; Quinet, P.; Hoyer, D.; Werner, K.; Demleitner, M.; Kruk, J. W.

content.subject: Atomic data
Line: identification
content.description: This service provides oscillator strengths and transition probabilities. Mainly based on experimental energy levels, these were calculated with the pseudo-relativistic Hartree-Fock method including core-polarization corrections.

param.name: log_gf
param.description: Calculated HFR log(gf) (g -- statistical weight of the lower level; f -- oscillator strength)

schema.name: toss
schema.title: TOSS -- Tübingen Oscillator Strengths Service
schema.description: This service provides oscillator strengths and transition probabilities. Mainly based on experimental energy levels, these were calculated with the pseudo-relativistic Hartree-Fock method including core-polarization corrections.

table.name: toss.data
table.description: A table of transitions, their species, and their properties.

column.name: wavelength
column.description: Wavelength of the transition.

column.name: linename
column.description: Terse descriptor of the line

column.name: chemical_element
column.description: Element transitioning

column.name: initial_name
column.description: Name of the level the atom or molecule starts in.

column.name: final_name
column.description: Name of the level the atom or molecule ends up in.

column.name: initial_level_energy
column.description: Energy of the level the atom or molecule starts in.

column.name: final_level_energy
column.description: Energy of the level the atom or molecule ends up in.

column.name: pub
column.description: The publication this value orginated from.

column.name: id_status
column.description: Identification status of the line

column.name: ion_stage
column.description: Ionisation stage

column.name: c_wavelength
column.description: Conventional wavelength of the transition. This is the air wavelength between 2000 and 20000 Angstrom, the vacuum wavelength otherwise.

column.name: par_init
column.description: Parity of the initer level of the transition

column.name: j_init
column.description: Angular momentum quantum number of the initer level of the transition.

column.name: par_final
column.description: Parity of the finaler level of the transition

column.name: j_final
column.description: Angular momentum quantum number of the finaler level of the transition.

column.name: log_gf
column.description: Calculated HFR log(gf) (g -- statistical weight of the lower level; f -- oscillator strength)

column.name: ga
column.description: Transition probability times the statistical weight of the upper level

column.name: cf
column.description: Cancellation factor as defined by 1981tass.book.....C

creator.name: Wright, E.L.; Cutri, R.C.; et al

content.subject: Catalogs
Surveys
Infrared photometry
content.description:
The Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE) is a space-based imaging survey of the entire sky in the 3.4 (W1), 4.6 (W2), 12 (W3), and 22 (W4) μm mid-infrared. This is the project's reliable Source Catalog containing accurate photometry and astrometry for over 500 million objects.
More details are available in the `Explanatory Supplement`_, which also has a list of `Cautionary Notes`_.
.. _Explanatory Supplement: http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/release/allsky/expsup/sec1_1.html .. _Cautionary Notes: http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/release/allsky/expsup/sec1_4b.html

param.name: MAXREC
param.description: Maximum number of records returned. Pass 0 to retrieve service parameters.

param.name: VERB
param.description: Exhaustiveness of column selection. VERB=1 only returns the most important columns, VERB=2 selects the columns deemed useful to the average user, VERB=3 returns a table with all available columns.

param.name: designation
param.description: Sexagesimal, equatorial position-based source name in the form: hhmmss.ss+ddmmss.s. The full naming convention for WISE All-Sky Release Catalog sources has the form 'WISE Jhhmmss.ss+ddmmss.s,', where WISE is not given in this column.

param.name: w1mpro
param.description: Magnitude at 3.4µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 3.4µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 3.4µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

param.name: w2mpro
param.description: Magnitude at 4.6µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 4.6µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 4.6µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

param.name: w3mpro
param.description: Magnitude at 12µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 12µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 12µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

param.name: w4mpro
param.description: Magnitude at 22µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 22µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 22µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

schema.name: wise
schema.title: WISE All-Sky Release Catalog
schema.description:
The Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE) is a space-based imaging survey of the entire sky in the 3.4 (W1), 4.6 (W2), 12 (W3), and 22 (W4) μm mid-infrared. This is the project's reliable Source Catalog containing accurate photometry and astrometry for over 500 million objects.
More details are available in the `Explanatory Supplement`_, which also has a list of `Cautionary Notes`_.
.. _Explanatory Supplement: http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/release/allsky/expsup/sec1_1.html .. _Cautionary Notes: http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/release/allsky/expsup/sec1_4b.html

table.name: wise.main
table.description: This is the All-Sky source catalog, with several columns left out since we considered them to be only relevant for re-reduction, too arcane, or just because of a whim on our side. If you need them, let us know. The columns left out include: elon, elat, source_id, w?nm w?m, w?cov, w?cc_map_str, w?flux, w?sigflux, w?sky, w?sigsk, w?conf, w?mag_?, w?sigm_?, w?flg_?, w?magp, w?sigp1, w?sigp2, rho??, r_2mass, pa_2mass, n_2mass, [jhk]_m_2mass, [jhk]_msig_2mass, best_use_cntr, ngrp, x, y, z, spt_ind

column.name: designation
column.description: Sexagesimal, equatorial position-based source name in the form: hhmmss.ss+ddmmss.s. The full naming convention for WISE All-Sky Release Catalog sources has the form 'WISE Jhhmmss.ss+ddmmss.s,', where WISE is not given in this column.

column.name: raj2000
column.description: J2000 right ascension with respect to the 2MASS PSC reference frame

column.name: dej2000
column.description: J2000 declination with respect to the 2MASS PSC reference frame.

column.name: sigra
column.description: One-sigma uncertainty in right ascension coordinate.

column.name: sigdec
column.description: One-sigma uncertainty in declination coordinate.

column.name: sigradec
column.description: The co-sigma of the equatorial position uncertainties, sig_ra, sig_dec (σα, σδ).

column.name: glon
column.description: Galactic longitude. CAUTION: This coordinate should not be used as an astrometric reference.

column.name: glat
column.description: Galactic latitude. CAUTION: This coordinate should not be used as an astrometric reference.

column.name: wx
column.description: The x-pixel coordinate of this source on the Atlas Image.

column.name: wy
column.description: The y-pixel coordinate of this source on the Atlas Image.

column.name: cntr
column.description: Unique identification number for the Catalog source.

column.name: coadd_id
column.description: Atlas Tile identifier from which source was extracted.

column.name: src
column.description: Sequential number of this source extraction in the Atlas Tile from which this source was extracted, in approximate descending order of W1 source brightness.

column.name: w1mpro
column.description: Magnitude at 3.4µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 3.4µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 3.4µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

column.name: w1sigmrpo
column.description: 3.4µm profile-fit photometric measurement uncertainty in mag units. This column is null if the 3.4µm profile-fit magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit or if the source is not measurable.

column.name: w1snr
column.description: 3.4µm profile-fit measurement signal-to-noise ratio. This value is the ratio of the flux (w1flux) to flux uncertainty (w1sigflux)in the W1 profile-fit photometry measurement. This column is null if w1flux is negative, or if w1flux or w1sigflux are null.

column.name: w1rchi2
column.description: Reduced χ² of the 3.4µm profile-fit photometry measurement. This column is null if the 3.4µm magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected).

column.name: w1sat
column.description: Saturated pixel fraction, 3.4µm. The fraction of all pixels within the profile-fitting area in the stack of single-exposure images used to characterize this source that are flagged as saturated. A value larger than 0.0 indicates one or more pixels of saturation. Saturation begins to occur for point sources brighter than [3.4µm]~8 mag. Saturation may occur in fainter sources because of a charged particle strike.

column.name: w1frtr
column.description: Fraction of pixels affected by transients. This column gives the fraction of all 3.4µm pixels in the stack of individual 3.4µm exposures used to characterize this source that may be affected by transient events. This number is computed by counting the number of pixels in the single exposure Bit Mask images with value "21" that are present within the profile-fitting area, a circular region with radius of 7.25", centered on the position of this source, and dividing by the total number of pixels in the same area that are available for measurement.

column.name: w1cc_map
column.description: Contamination and confusion map for this source in 3.4µm

column.name: w1mag
column.description: 3.4µm "standard" aperture magnitude. This is the curve-of-growth corrected source brightness measured in an 8.25" radius circular aperture centered on the source position on the Atlas Image. If the source is not detected in the aperture measurement, this is the 95% confidence upper limit to the brightness. The background sky reference level is measured in an annular region with inner radius of 50" and outer radius of 70". The curve-of-growth correction is given in 3.4µmmcor.

column.name: w1sigm
column.description: Uncertainty in the 3.4µm "standard" aperture magnitude. This column is null if the 3.4µm "standard" aperture magnitude is an upper limit, or if an aperture measurement was not possible.

column.name: w1flg
column.description: 3.4µm "standard" aperture measurement quality flag.

column.name: w1mcor
column.description: 3.4µm aperture curve-of-growth correction, in magnitudes. This correction is subtracted from the nominal 8.25" aperture photometry brightness to give the "standard-aperture" magnitude.

column.name: w1dmag
column.description: Difference between maximum and minimum magnitude of the source from all usable single-exposure frames, 3.4µm. Single-exposure measurements with w1rchi2 values greater than 3.0 times the median are rejected from this computation.

column.name: w1ndf
column.description: Number of degrees of freedom in the flux variability chi-square, 3.4µm.

column.name: w1mlq
column.description: Probability measure that the source is variable in 3.4µm flux.

column.name: w1mjdmin
column.description: The earliest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 3.4µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w1mjdmax
column.description: The latest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 3.4µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w1mjdmean
column.description: The average modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 3.4µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w1rsemi
column.description: Semi-major axis of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 3.4µm

column.name: w1ba
column.description: Axis ratio (b/a) of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 3.4µm

column.name: w1pa
column.description: Position angle (degrees E of N) of the elliptical aperture major axis used to measure source in 3.4µm

column.name: w1gmag
column.description: 3.4µm magnitude of source measured in the elliptical aperture described by w1rsemi, w1w1ba, and w1w1pa.

column.name: w1gerr
column.description: Uncertainty in the 3.4µm magnitude of source measured in elliptical aperture.

column.name: w1gflg
column.description: W1 elliptical aperture measurement quality flag. This flag indicates if one or more image pixels in the measurement aperture for this band is confused with nearby objects, is contaminated by saturated or otherwise unusable pixels, or is an upper limit.

column.name: w2mpro
column.description: Magnitude at 4.6µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 4.6µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 4.6µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

column.name: w2sigmrpo
column.description: 4.6µm profile-fit photometric measurement uncertainty in mag units. This column is null if the 4.6µm profile-fit magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit or if the source is not measurable.

column.name: w2snr
column.description: 4.6µm profile-fit measurement signal-to-noise ratio. This value is the ratio of the flux (w2flux) to flux uncertainty (w2sigflux)in the W1 profile-fit photometry measurement. This column is null if w2flux is negative, or if w2flux or w2sigflux are null.

column.name: w2rchi2
column.description: Reduced χ² of the 4.6µm profile-fit photometry measurement. This column is null if the 4.6µm magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected).

column.name: w2sat
column.description: Saturated pixel fraction, 4.6µm. The fraction of all pixels within the profile-fitting area in the stack of single-exposure images used to characterize this source that are flagged as saturated. A value larger than 0.0 indicates one or more pixels of saturation. Saturation begins to occur for point sources brighter than [4.6µm]~7 mag. Saturation may occur in fainter sources because of a charged particle strike.

column.name: w2frtr
column.description: Fraction of pixels affected by transients. This column gives the fraction of all 4.6µm pixels in the stack of individual 4.6µm exposures used to characterize this source that may be affected by transient events. This number is computed by counting the number of pixels in the single exposure Bit Mask images with value "21" that are present within the profile-fitting area, a circular region with radius of 7.25", centered on the position of this source, and dividing by the total number of pixels in the same area that are available for measurement.

column.name: w2cc_map
column.description: Contamination and confusion map for this source in 4.6µm

column.name: w2mag
column.description: 4.6µm "standard" aperture magnitude. This is the curve-of-growth corrected source brightness measured in an 8.25" radius circular aperture centered on the source position on the Atlas Image. If the source is not detected in the aperture measurement, this is the 95% confidence upper limit to the brightness. The background sky reference level is measured in an annular region with inner radius of 50" and outer radius of 70". The curve-of-growth correction is given in 4.6µmmcor.

column.name: w2sigm

column.name: w2flg
column.description: 4.6µm "standard" aperture measurement quality flag.

column.name: w2mcor
column.description: 4.6µm aperture curve-of-growth correction, in magnitudes. This correction is subtracted from the nominal 8.25" aperture photometry brightness to give the "standard-aperture" magnitude.

column.name: w2dmag
column.description: Difference between maximum and minimum magnitude of the source from all usable single-exposure frames, 4.6µm. Single-exposure measurements with w2rchi2 values greater than 3.0 times the median are rejected from this computation.

column.name: w2ndf
column.description: Number of degrees of freedom in the flux variability chi-square, 4.6µm.

column.name: w2mlq
column.description: Probability measure that the source is variable in 4.6µm flux.

column.name: w2mjdmin
column.description: The earliest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 4.6µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w2mjdmax
column.description: The latest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 4.6µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w2mjdmean
column.description: The average modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 4.6µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w2rsemi
column.description: Semi-major axis of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 4.6µm

column.name: w2ba
column.description: Axis ratio (b/a) of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 4.6µm

column.name: w2pa
column.description: Position angle (degrees E of N) of the elliptical aperture major axis used to measure source in 4.6µm

column.name: w2gmag
column.description: 4.6µm magnitude of source measured in the elliptical aperture described by w2rsemi, w2w1ba, and w2w1pa.

column.name: w2gerr
column.description: Uncertainty in the 4.6µm magnitude of source measured in elliptical aperture.

column.name: w2gflg
column.description: W1 elliptical aperture measurement quality flag. This flag indicates if one or more image pixels in the measurement aperture for this band is confused with nearby objects, is contaminated by saturated or otherwise unusable pixels, or is an upper limit.

column.name: w3mpro
column.description: Magnitude at 12µm measured with profile-fitting photometry, or the magnitude of the 95% confidence brightness upper limit if the 12µm flux measurement has SNR<2. This column is null if the source is nominally detected in 12µm, but no useful brightness estimate could be made.

column.name: w3sigmrpo
column.description: 12µm profile-fit photometric measurement uncertainty in mag units. This column is null if the 12µm profile-fit magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit or if the source is not measurable.

column.name: w3snr

column.name: w3rchi2
column.description: Reduced χ² of the 12µm profile-fit photometry measurement. This column is null if the 12µm magnitude is a 95% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected).

column.name: w3sat
column.description: Saturated pixel fraction, 12µm. The fraction of all pixels within the profile-fitting area in the stack of single-exposure images used to characterize this source that are flagged as saturated. A value larger than 0.0 indicates one or more pixels of saturation. Saturation begins to occur for point sources brighter than [12µm]~4 mag. Saturation may occur in fainter sources because of a charged particle strike.

column.name: w3frtr
column.description: Fraction of pixels affected by transients. This column gives the fraction of all 12µm pixels in the stack of individual 12µm exposures used to characterize this source that may be affected by transient events. This number is computed by counting the number of pixels in the single exposure Bit Mask images with value "21" that are present within the profile-fitting area, a circular region with radius of 7.25", centered on the position of this source, and dividing by the total number of pixels in the same area that are available for measurement.

column.name: w3cc_map
column.description: Contamination and confusion map for this source in 12µm

column.name: w3mag
column.description: 12µm "standard" aperture magnitude. This is the curve-of-growth corrected source brightness measured in an 8.25" radius circular aperture centered on the source position on the Atlas Image. If the source is not detected in the aperture measurement, this is the 95% confidence upper limit to the brightness. The background sky reference level is measured in an annular region with inner radius of 50" and outer radius of 70". The curve-of-growth correction is given in 12µmmcor.

column.name: w4sat
column.description: Saturated pixel fraction, 22µm. The fraction of all pixels within the profile-fitting area in the stack of single-exposure images used to characterize this source that are flagged as saturated. A value larger than 0.0 indicates one or more pixels of saturation. Saturation begins to occur for point sources brighter than [22µm]~0 mag. Saturation may occur in fainter sources because of a charged particle strike.

column.name: w4frtr
column.description: Fraction of pixels affected by transients. This column gives the fraction of all 22µm pixels in the stack of individual 22µm exposures used to characterize this source that may be affected by transient events. This number is computed by counting the number of pixels in the single exposure Bit Mask images with value "21" that are present within the profile-fitting area, a circular region with radius of 7.25", centered on the position of this source, and dividing by the total number of pixels in the same area that are available for measurement.

column.name: w4cc_map
column.description: Contamination and confusion map for this source in 22µm

column.name: w4mag
column.description: 22µm "standard" aperture magnitude. This is the curve-of-growth corrected source brightness measured in an 8.25" radius circular aperture centered on the source position on the Atlas Image. If the source is not detected in the aperture measurement, this is the 95% confidence upper limit to the brightness. The background sky reference level is measured in an annular region with inner radius of 50" and outer radius of 70". The curve-of-growth correction is given in 22µmmcor.

column.description: 22µm aperture curve-of-growth correction, in magnitudes. This correction is subtracted from the nominal 8.25" aperture photometry brightness to give the "standard-aperture" magnitude.

column.name: w4mjdmin
column.description: The earliest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 22µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w4mjdmax
column.description: The latest modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 22µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w4mjdmean
column.description: The average modified Julian Date (mJD) of the 22µm single-exposures covering the source.

column.name: w4rsemi
column.description: Semi-major axis of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 22µm

column.name: w4ba
column.description: Axis ratio (b/a) of the elliptical aperture used to measure source in 22µm

column.name: w4pa
column.description: Position angle (degrees E of N) of the elliptical aperture major axis used to measure source in 22µm

column.name: w4gmag
column.description: 22µm magnitude of source measured in the elliptical aperture described by w4rsemi, w4w1ba, and w4w1pa.

column.name: w4gerr
column.description: Uncertainty in the 22µm magnitude of source measured in elliptical aperture.

column.name: w4gflg
column.description: W1 elliptical aperture measurement quality flag. This flag indicates if one or more image pixels in the measurement aperture for this band is confused with nearby objects, is contaminated by saturated or otherwise unusable pixels, or is an upper limit.

column.name: rchi2
column.description: Combined reduced χ² of the profile-fit photometry measurement in all bands.

column.name: nb
column.description: Number of PSF components used simultaneously in the profile-fitting for this source. This is greater than "1" when the source is fit concurrently with other nearby detections (passive deblending), or when a single source is split into two components during the fitting process (active deblending).

column.name: na
column.description: Active deblending flag. Indicates if a single detection was split into multiple sources in the process of profile-fitting.

column.name: satnum
column.description: Minimum sample at which saturation occurs in each band. Four character string, one character per band, that indicates the minimum SUTR sample in which any pixel in the profile-fitting area in all of the single-exposure images used to characterize this source was flagged as having reached the saturation level in the on-board WISE payload processing. If no pixels in a given band are flagged as saturated, the value for that band is '0'.

column.name: cc_flags
column.description: Contamination and confusion flag.

column.name: ext_flg
column.description: Extended source flag.

column.name: var_flg
column.description: Variability flag.

column.name: ph_qual
column.description: Photometric quality flag.

column.name: det_bit
column.description: Bit-encoded integer indicating bands in which a source has a w?snr>2 detection. For example, a source detected in W1 only has det_bit=1 (binary 0001). A source detected in W4 only has det_bit=8 (binary 1000). A source detected in all four bands has det_bit=15 (binary 1111).

column.name: q12
column.description: Correlation significance between 3.4µm and 4.6µm.

column.name: q23
column.description: Correlation significance between 4.6µm and 12µm.

column.name: q34
column.description: Correlation significance between 12µm and 22µm.

column.name: xscprox
column.description: 2MASS Extended Source Catalog (XSC) proximity. This column gives the distance between the WISE source position and the position of a nearby 2MASS XSC source, if the separation is less than 1.1 times the Ks isophotal radius size of the XSC source. This identifies WISE sources that are identically the 2MASS XSC source as well as WISE sources that are fragments of large galaxies.

column.name: tmass_key
column.description: 2MASS PSC association. Unique identifier of the closest source in the 2MASS Point Source Catalog (PSC) that falls within 3" of the position of this WISE source. You can use this join to towmass.data, the pts_key column there.

content.subject: Virtual observatory
Catalogs
ADQL
content.description:
The GAVO Data Center's TAP end point. The Table Access Protocol (TAP) lets you execute queries against our database tables, inspect various metadata, and upload your own data.
In GAVO's data center, we in particular hold several large catalogs like PPMXL, 2MASS PSC, USNO-B2, UCAC4, WISE, SDSS DR7, for you to use in crossmatches, possibly with uploaded tables.
Tables exposed through this endpoint include: main, usnocorr from the ppmxl schema, main from the emi schema, data from the theossa schema, data from the veronqsos schema, objects, photpar from the sasmirala schema, plates, wolfpalisa from the lsw schema, main from the dmubin schema, data, platecorrs, plates, ppmxcross, spurious, twomasscross from the usnob schema, frames from the apo schema, main from the lspm schema, dr2, dr3, main from the rave schema, nucand from the icecube schema, plates from the kapteyn schema, exts from the mcextinct schema, data from the ppmx schema, sources from the supercosmos schema, capability, interface, intf_param, relationship, res_date, res_detail, res_role, res_schema, res_subject, res_table, resource, stc_redshift, stc_spatial, stc_spectral, stc_temporal, table_column, validation from the rr schema, main from the auger schema, data from the inflight schema, meta from the carsarcs schema, main from the hipparcos schema, measurements, stations from the lightmeter schema, data from the toss schema, gfh, id, identified, master, nid, unidentified from the arigfh schema, main from the annisred schema, main from the wfpdb schema, chemical, key_points, out_file, physic_file, program_param, proprieties, scenario, units from the basti schema, main, stars from the mwsce14a schema, data from the hiicounter schema, data from the danish schema, rawframes from the liverpool schema, mpcorb from the mpc schema, data from the gcpms schema, images, srccat from the cars schema, photons from the rosat schema, plates, rawplates from the potsdam schema, data from the plctmp schema, main, stars from the mwsc schema, bibrefs, maps, masers, monitor from the ohmaser schema, main from the smakced schema, cat from the browndwarfs schema, stripe82 from the vlastripe82 schema, sources from the sdssdr7 schema, data from the twomass schema, data from the obscode schema, katkat from the katkat schema, main from the taptest schema, icrscorr, main, ppmxlcross from the ucac3 schema, data, ordersmeta from the flashheros schema, main from the wise schema, main from the ucac4 schema, main from the arihip schema, data from the feros schema, columns, groups, key_columns, keys, schemas, tables from the tap_schema schema, cubes, fluxposv1200, fluxposv500, fluxv1200, fluxv500, objects, spectra from the califadr1 schema, cubes, fluxposv1200, fluxposv500, fluxv1200, fluxv500, objects, spectra from the califadr2 schema, galaxies, lmc, mw, quasars, smc, sn from the gums schema, main from the spm4 schema, rawframes from the maidanak schema, columns, services, tables from the glots schema, data from the plc schema, cubes, slitspectra from the mlqso schema, nucand from the amanda schema, emptyobscore, obscore from the ivoa schema, fk6join, part1, part3 from the fk6 schema.

feature.description: gavo_match returns 1 if the POSIX regular expression pattern matches anything in string, 0 otherwise.
An aggregate function returning all values of expression within a GROUP contcatenated with delimiter

The function converts a postgres timestamp to julian date. This is naive; no corrections for timezones, let alone time scales or the like are done; you can thus not expect this to be good to second-precision unless you are careful in the construction of the timestamp.

The function converts a postgres timestamp to modified julian date. This is naive; no corrections for timezones, let alone time scales or the like are done; you can thus not expect this to be good to second-precision unless you are careful in the construction of the timestamp.

The function takes two strings; the first is a list of words not containing the hash sign (#), concatenated by hash signs, the second is a word not containing the hash sign. It returns 1 if, compared case-insensitively, the second argument is in the list of words coded in the first argument. The behaviour in case the the second argument contains a hash sign is unspecified.

feature.form: ivo_apply_pm(ra DOUBLE PRECISION, dec DOUBLE PRECISION, pmra DOUBLE PRECISION, pmde DOUBLE PRECISON, epdist DOUBLE PRECISION) -> POINT
feature.description:
Returns a POINT (in the UNDEFINED reference frame) for the position an object at ra/dec with proper motion pmra/pmde has after epdist years.
positions must be in degrees, PMs in should be in julian years (i.e., proper motions are expected in degrees/year). pmra is assumed to contain cos(delta).
NOTE: This currently is a crappy approximation that does *not* go through the tangential plane. If you use it, let the operators know so we replace it with something real.

ivo_nocasematch returns 1 if pattern matches value, 0 otherwise. pattern is defined as for the SQL LIKE operator, but the match is performed case-insensitively. This function in effect provides a surrogate for the ILIKE SQL operator that is missing from ADQL.

gavo_hasword returns 1 if needle shows up in haystack, 0 otherwise. This is for "google-like"-searches in text-like fields. In word, you can actually employ a fairly complex query language; see http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.3/static/textsearch.html for details.

schema.name: amanda
schema.title: AMANDA-II neutrino candidates
schema.description: A list of neutrino candidate events recorded by the AMANDA-II neutrino telescope during the period 2000-2006.

table.name: amanda.nucand
table.description: Detection parameters of neutrino candidates recorded by the AMANDA-II telescope. This table can be queried on the web at http://dc.g-vo.org/amanda/q/web

column.name: id
column.description: Artifical primary key.

column.name: nualpha
column.description: Neutrino arrival direction, RA

column.name: nudelta
column.description: Neutrino arrival direction, Declination

column.name: nch
column.description: Number of optical modules hit in an event

column.name: angularres
column.description: Angular resolution of a neutrino event

column.name: mjd
column.description: Observation time, Modified Julian Day

column.name: atmonusubset
column.description: Subset of candidates used in AMANDA's seven-year atmospheric neutrino analysis

schema.name: annisred
schema.title: Stripe 82 Photometric Redshifts from SDSS Coadditions
schema.description: This survey gives photometric redshifts of objects within 275 deg² (−50◦ < α < 60◦ and −1.◦25 < δ < +1.◦25) centered on the Celestial Equator. Each piece of sky has ∼20 runs of repeated scanning by the SDSS camera contributing and thus reaches ∼2 mag fainter than the SDSS single pass data, i.e., to r ∼ 23.5 for galaxies.

table.name: annisred.main
table.description: This survey gives photometric redshifts of objects within 275 deg² (−50◦ < α < 60◦ and −1.◦25 < δ < +1.◦25) centered on the Celestial Equator. Each piece of sky has ∼20 runs of repeated scanning by the SDSS camera contributing and thus reaches ∼2 mag fainter than the SDSS single pass data, i.e., to r ∼ 23.5 for galaxies.

column.name: objid
column.description: Unique SDSS identifier.

column.name: run
column.description: Run number

column.name: rerun
column.description: Rerun number

column.name: camcol
column.description: Camera column

column.name: fieldid
column.description: Field number

column.name: obj
column.description: The object id within a field. Usually changes between reruns of the same field.

column.name: raj2000
column.description: Right ascension of the object.

column.name: dej2000
column.description: Declination of the object.

column.name: zphot
column.description: Photometric redshift from SDSS' PHOTO pipeline

column.name: zphoterr
column.description: Error in the photometric redshift from SDSS' PHOTO pipeline

schema.name: apo
schema.title: Apache Point observations of lensed quasars
schema.description: Observations of the lensed quasar Q2237+0305 performed between 1995 and 1998.

table.name: apo.frames
table.description: Observations of the lensed quasar Q2237+0305 performed between 1995 and 1998.

column.description: Date the data will become/became public

column.description: The pixel scale on each image axis

column.description: Equinox of the given coordinates

column.description: Freeform name of the bandpass used

column.description: Unit of bandpass specifications (always m).

column.description: Characteristic quantity for the bandpass of the image

schema.name: arigfh
schema.title: ARIGFH object catalog
schema.description:
ARI's "Geschichte des Fixsternhimmels" is an attempt to collect all astrometrically useful observations from before ca. 1970 in a way comparable to what has been done to construct the FK* series of fundamental catalogs. About 7e6 published positions are included.
In GAVO's DC, we provide tables of identified and non-identified stars together with the master catalog that objects were identified against.

table.name: arigfh.master
table.description: The master catalog against which all ARIGFH historical observations were matched.

column.name: catno
column.description: Identification number in the ARIGFH master catalog

column.name: raj2000
column.description: Master Right Ascension, Epoch and Equinox J2000

column.name: dej2000
column.description: Master Declination, Epoch and Equinox J2000

column.description: Master Proper Motion in RA, Epoch and Equinox J2000, cos(delta) applied

column.description: Master Proper motion in Declination, Epoch and Equinox J2000

column.description: Visual magnitude in the master catalog

column.name: mb
column.description: Blue magnitude in the master catalog

column.name: component
column.description: Component designation in a multiple system in the master catalog

schema.name: arihip
schema.title: ARIHIP astrometric catalogue
schema.description: The catalogue ARIHIP has been constructed by selecting the 'best data' for a given star from combinations of HIPPARCOS data with Boss' GC and/or the Tycho-2 catalogue as well as the FK6. It provides 'best data' for 90 842 stars with a typical mean error of 0.89 mas/year (about a factor of 1.3 better than Hipparcos for this sample of stars).

table.name: arihip.main
table.description: The catalogue ARIHIP has been constructed by selecting the 'best data' for a given star from combinations of HIPPARCOS data with Boss' GC and/or the Tycho-2 catalogue as well as the FK6. It provides 'best data' for 90 842 stars with a typical mean error of 0.89 mas/year (about a factor of 1.3 better than Hipparcos for this sample of stars).

column.name: hipno
column.description: Number of the star in the HIPPARCOS Catalogue (ESA 1997).

column.name: srcsel
column.description: Source of the astrometric solution

column.name: raj2000
column.description: Right ascension from a single-star solution

column.name: dej2000
column.description: Declination from a single-star solution

column.name: pmra
column.description: Proper motion in right ascension times cos(delta) for a single-star solution.

column.name: pmde
column.description: Proper motion in declination for a single-star solution.

column.name: t_ra
column.description: Central epoch of RA (SI)

column.name: err_ra
column.description: Error in RA from the single star solution, with cos(delta) already applied

column.name: err_pmra
column.description: Mean error in PM(RA)*cos(delta) from the single star solution

column.name: t_de
column.description: Central epoch of Dec (SI)

column.name: err_de
column.description: Error in Dec from the single star solution

column.name: err_pmde
column.description: Mean error in PM(Dec) form the single star solution

column.name: parallax
column.description: Parallax used in deriving the data of the star in the catalogue selected for the ARIHIP. This is either the HIPPARCOS parallax or a photometric/spectroscopic parallax (see Kp).

column.name: e_parallax
column.description: Mean error of the parallax

column.name: kp
column.description: Source of the parallax: H Hipparcos, P photometric parallax

column.name: vrad
column.description: Radial velocity as used in calculating the foreshortening effect.

column.name: mv
column.description: Visual magnitude taken from the HIPPARCOS catalogue

column.name: km
column.description: Variability flag. See note.

column.name: kbin
column.description: Binarity flag. See note.

schema.name: califadr1
schema.title: Calar Alto Legacy Integral Field spectroscopy Area survey
schema.description:
CALIFA is obtaining spatially resolved spectroscopic information of a diameter selected sample of 600 galaxies in the Local Universe (0.005 < z < 0.03). It has been designed to allow the building of two-dimensional maps of the following quantities:
* stellar populations: ages and metallicities; * ionized gas: distribution, excitation mechanism and chemical abundances * kinematic properties: both from stellar and ionized gas components.
CALIFA uses the PPAK integral field unit (IFU), with a hexagonal field-of-view of 1.3 square arcmin, with a 100% covering factor by adopting a three-pointing dithering scheme. The optical wavelength range is covered from 3700 to 7000 Å, using two overlapping setups (V500 and V1200), with different resolutions of about 850 and 1650, respectively. CALIFA is a legacy survey, intended for the community and its current Data Release 1 provides access to the first 100 galaxies.

table.name: califadr1.spectra
table.description: Metadata for individual spectra. Note that the spectra result from reducing a complex dithering scheme and are not independent from one another.

table.name: califadr2.fluxposv1200
table.description:
Data cubes of positions and fluxes in the optical for a sample of galaxies, obtained by the CALIFA project in the v1200 setup.
Note that due to the dithering scheme, the points here do not actually correspond to raw measurements but instead represent a reduction of several measurements.

schema.name: carsarcs
schema.title: Gravitational arc candidates in the CFHTLS-Archive-Research Survey CARS
schema.description: Candidate gravitational arcs in the 37 deg^2 of CFHTLS-Archive-Research Survey (CARS). The data include their post-stamp images, astrometry, photometry (u*,g',r',i'), geometric properties (length, length-to-width ratio, profile curvature, area), and photometric redshifts. The arc candidates were selected booth with an automatic arcfinder, based on a tailored image segmentation and a color selection, and by visually inspecting the survey.

table.title: Magnitudes, redshifts, positions, etc. of the arcs found in CARS.

The data include their post-stamp images, astrometry, photometry (u*,g',r',i'), geometric properties (length, length-to-width ratio, profile curvature, area), and photometric redshifts. The arc candidates were selected booth with an automatic arcfinder, based on a tailored image segmentation and a color selection, and by visually inspecting the survey.

schema.name: emi
schema.title: VLBI images of Lockman Hole radio sources
schema.description:
These are 1.4GHz Very Long Baseline Interferometry images of 532 radio sources with a flux density exceeding 100uJy as determined by Ibar et al. (2009, MNRAS, 397, 281), obtained between 2010-06-03 and 2010-09-03.
For all fields, we give frames processed using natural weighting to preserve maximal sensitivity. For the 65 detected sources, we additionally give frames processed using uniform weighting to suppress sidelobes (see Middelberg et al. 2013, A&A 551, 97 for details) in flux density measurements. Some sources have larger images to cover a larger area because the initial coordinates were not sufficiently accurate.

table.name: emi.main
table.description:
These are 1.4GHz Very Long Baseline Interferometry images of 532 radio sources with a flux density exceeding 100uJy as determined by Ibar et al. (2009, MNRAS, 397, 281), obtained between 2010-06-03 and 2010-09-03.
For all fields, we give frames processed using natural weighting to preserve maximal sensitivity. For the 65 detected sources, we additionally give frames processed using uniform weighting to suppress sidelobes (see Middelberg et al. 2013, A&A 551, 97 for details) in flux density measurements. Some sources have larger images to cover a larger area because the initial coordinates were not sufficiently accurate.

schema.name: fk6
schema.title: The Sixth Fundamental Catalogue
schema.description:
Parts I and III of the sixth fundamental catalog, a catalog of high-precision astrometry for bright stars combining centuries of ground-based observations as reflected in FK5 with HIPPARCOS astrometry.
The result contains, in particular for the proper motions, statistically significant improvements of the Hipparcos data und represents a system of unprecedented accuracy for these 4150 fundamental stars. The typical mean error in pm is 0.35 mas/year for 878 basic stars, and 0.59 mas/year for the sample of the 3272 additional stars.

schema.name: glots
schema.title: GloTS, the Global TAP Schema
schema.description:
The global TAP schema collects information on tables and columns from known TAP servers. This facilitates locating queriable data by physics (via UCD) or keywords (via description).
Note that this shouldn't really be necessary as all information present here should be exposed through Registry records. However, in reality data providers currently are much more liable to give column metadata in their tap_schema than in their Registry records. Hence, for the time being, we maintain this service by harvesting tap_schemas about monthly.

table.name: glots.services
table.description: A table of TAP services harvested from the registry (and some spoon-fed).

schema.name: gums
schema.title: The GAIA Universe Model Snapshot 10
schema.description: GUMS-10 is the 10th version of the Gaia Universe Model Snapshot, a simulation of the expected contents of the Gaia cataloge run at the MareNostrum supercomputer. The models used and the characteristics of GUMS-10 are described in: A.C. Robin et al, "Gaia Universe Model Snapshot. A statistical analysis of the expected contents of the Gaia catalogue", Astronomy & Astrophysics (2012), in press. For more details see also http://gaia.am.ub.es/GUMS-10/

table.name: gums.quasars
table.description: Quasars in the GUMS-10 simulated GAIA result set. This reflects the scheme laid down in gAIA-C2-TN-OCA-ES-001-1, i.e., SDSS quasar properties extrapolated to G=20.5.

schema.name: kapteyn
schema.title: Potsdam Kapteyn Series Plates
schema.description: In the context of Kapteyn's plan to obtain a photometric standard, in Potsdam more than 400 photographic plates of several Selected Areas, Special Areas, and Kapteyn-Pritchard areas were obtained between 1910 and 1933, both as direct images and with an object prism. This service provides FITS images of the science area of the plates as well as images of the entire plates, including previous markings.

This service provides FITS images of the science area of the plates as well as images of the entire plates, including previous markings.

schema.name: katkat
schema.title: ARI Catalog of Catalogs
schema.description:
ARI katkat is a catalog of star catalogues in the spirit of G. Teleki's catalog of star catalogs (`1989BOBeo.140..131T`_ and references in there). It contains 2573 catalogs suitable for astrometric usage, starting with Flamsteed (1835) and ending in the 1970ies. For almost all of them, there is a column description file (as PDF, and unfortunately sometimes in German) and the digitized content.
.. _1989BOBeo.140..131T: http://ads.g-vo.org/abs/1989BOBeo.140..131T

table.name: katkat.katkat
table.description: The "catalog of catalogs" lists catalogs containing stellar positions for the last centuries. It also lets you access digitized table data.

schema.name: lightmeter
schema.title: Lightmeter Data
schema.description:
We give continuous night and day light measurements at all natural outdoor light levels by a network of low-cost lightmeters. Developed to start simple, global continuous high cadence monitoring of night sky brightness and artificial night sky brightening (light pollution) in 2009. The lightmeter network is a project of the Thüringer Landessternwarte, Tautenburg, Germany and the Kuffner-Sternwarte society at the Kuffner-Observatory, Vienna, Austria.
It started as part of the Dark Skies Awareness cornerstone of the International Year of Astronomy.

schema.name: liverpool
schema.title: Liverpool Quasar Lens Monitoring
schema.description: This collection includes optical monitorings of gravitationally lensed quasars. The frames can be used to make light curves of quasar images and field objects. From quasar light curves, one may measure time delays and flux ratios, analyse variability and chromaticity, etc. These direct analyses/measurements are basic tools for different astrophysical studies, e.g., expansion rate of the Universe, mechanism of intrinsic variability in quasars, accretion disk structure, supermassive black holes, dark halos of galaxies (dust, collapsed dark matter, smoothly distributed dark matter,...)

schema.name: lspm
schema.title: The Lepine-Shara Catalog of High Proper Motion Stars
schema.description:
The LSPM catalog is a comprehensive list of 61,977 stars north of the J2000 celestial equator that have proper motions larger than 0.15"/yr (local-background-stars frame).
Positions are given with an accuracy of <~100 mas at the 2000.0 epoch, and absolute proper motions are given with an accuracy of ~8 mas/yr. The catalog is estimated to be over 99% complete at high Galactic latitudes (|b|>15{deg}) and over 90% complete at low Galactic latitudes (|b|>15{deg}), down to a magnitude.

table.name: lspm.main
table.description:
The LSPM catalog is a comprehensive list of 61,977 stars north of the J2000 celestial equator that have proper motions larger than 0.15"/yr (local-background-stars frame).
Positions are given with an accuracy of <~100 mas at the 2000.0 epoch, and absolute proper motions are given with an accuracy of ~8 mas/yr. The catalog is estimated to be over 99% complete at high Galactic latitudes (|b|>15{deg}) and over 90% complete at low Galactic latitudes (|b|>15{deg}), down to a magnitude.

schema.name: mcextinct
schema.title: Reddening and Extinction maps of the Magellanic Clouds
schema.description: A catalogue of E(V-I) extinction values is presented for 3174 (LMC) and 693 (SMC) fields within the Magellanic Clouds. The extinction values were computed by determining the (V-I) colour difference of the red clump from Optical Gravitational Microlensing Experiment (OGLE III) observations in the V and I bands and theoretical values for unreddend red clump colours.

schema.name: mlqso
schema.title: Spectra of Strongly Lensed Quasars
schema.description: An archive of optical and near-infrared spectra of strongly lensed quasars and the lensing galaxies. The spectra are resolved to about a few Ångstroms and are flux-calibrated. The spectra resulted from deblending the lensed images in bidimensional spectra available from the SSAP service for `ivo://org.gavo.dc/mlqso/q/s <http://dc.zah.uni-heidelberg.de/mlqso/q/s/info>`_.

table.description: Bidimensional spectra of galaxies lensing QSOs.

schema.name: mpc
schema.title: Minor Planet Center - Asteroid Orbital Data
schema.description:
Complete Asteroid Data from the Minor Planet Center (MPC), updated once per month. The MPC operates at the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory under the auspices of Division III of the International Astronomical Union (IAU).
The MPC Orbit database contains orbital elements of minor planets that have been published in the Minor Planet Circulars, the Minor Planet Orbit Supplement and the Minor Planet Electronic Circulars.

table.name: mpc.mpcorb
table.description:
Complete Asteroid Data from the Minor Planet Center (MPC), updated once per month. The MPC operates at the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory under the auspices of Division III of the International Astronomical Union (IAU).
The MPC Orbit database contains orbital elements of minor planets that have been published in the Minor Planet Circulars, the Minor Planet Orbit Supplement and the Minor Planet Electronic Circulars.

column.name: uncertainty
column.description: Quality code (0 is best) as per http://www.minorplanetcenter.org/iau/info/UValue.html. Or: E -- the orbital eccentricity was assumed; D -- for one-opposition orbits this means a double (or multiple) designation is involved; F -- an e-assumed double (or multiple) designation is involved.

schema.name: mwsc
schema.title: Global Survey of Star Clusters in the Milky Way
schema.description: MWSC presents a list of 3006 Milky Way Stellar Clusters (MWSC), found in the 2MAst (2MASS with Astrometry) catalogue. The target list was compiled on the basis of present-day lists of open, globular and candidate clusters. For confirmed clusters we determined a homogeneous set of astrophysical parameters such as membership, angular radii of the main morphological parts, mean cluster proper motions, distances, reddenings, ages, tidal parameters, and sometimes radial velocities.

table.name: mwsc.main
table.description: A list of milky way stellar cluster candidates and objects, together with the notes and parameters from confirmed objects for the original publication.

schema.name: mwsce14a
schema.title: Global Survey of Star Clusters in the Milky Way. III. 139 new open clusters at high Galactic latitudes
schema.description:
MWSC-e14a ("MWSC extension 2014a") is a catalogue of 139 new open clusters at high Galactic latitudes (\|b\|>20 deg) including lists of candidate members. It extends the Kharchenko et al. 'Catalog of Milky Way Star Clusters'. The target list was compiled as density enhancements found in the 2MASS point source catalogue. For confirmed clusters we determined a homogeneous set of astrophysical parameters such as membership, angular radii of the main morphological parts, proper motion, distance, reddening, age, and tidal parameters.
.. _Catalog of Milky Way Star Clusters: http://dc.g-vo.org/mwsc/q/clu/form

table.description:
MWSC-e14a ("MWSC extension 2014a") is a catalogue of 139 new open clusters at high Galactic latitudes (\|b\|>20 deg) including lists of candidate members. It extends the Kharchenko et al. 'Catalog of Milky Way Star Clusters'. The target list was compiled as density enhancements found in the 2MASS point source catalogue. For confirmed clusters we determined a homogeneous set of astrophysical parameters such as membership, angular radii of the main morphological parts, proper motion, distance, reddening, age, and tidal parameters.
.. _Catalog of Milky Way Star Clusters: http://dc.g-vo.org/mwsc/q/clu/form

schema.name: obscode
schema.title: Observatory Codes
schema.description:
List of Observatory Codes assigned by the Minor Planet Center (MPC). The codes are used in cataloguing astrometric observations of small bodies in the solar system. A code is unique for a certain location and consists of three digits or one letter and two digits.
In this representation, we give the observatory code, the geocentric coordinates, and the observatory designation.

table.name: obscode.data
table.description:
List of Observatory Codes assigned by the Minor Planet Center (MPC). The codes are used in cataloguing astrometric observations of small bodies in the solar system. A code is unique for a certain location and consists of three digits or one letter and two digits.
In this representation, we give the observatory code, the geocentric coordinates, and the observatory designation.

schema.name: ohmaser
schema.title: A Database of Circumstellar OH Masers
schema.description: A all-sky compilation of galactic stellar sources observed for OH maser emission in the transitions at 1612, 1665, and 1667 MHz. The database contains OH maser observations selected from the literature . These observations belong to more than 6000 different objects. The database consists of three tables: The main table ("masers"), interferometric followup observations ("maps") and monitoring programs ("monitor").

column.name: measure_no
column.description: Unique measurement identifier

column.name: source_no
column.description: Unique, artificial source identifier

column.name: flag
column.description: Non-null if this measurement is considered the best available at a particular frequency. Lower means higher confidence.

column.name: source_name
column.description: Name of the observed source. The name given in the reference is usually kept.

column.name: frequency
column.description: Observed frequency

column.name: spec_type
column.description: S -- Single peak of maser emission; D -- Double peak of maser emission; I -- Irregular spectral profile, multiple emission peaks; NULL means a non-detection

column.name: ra_raw
column.description: J2000 RA

column.name: de_raw
column.description: J2000 Dec

column.name: veloc_shell
column.description: Outflow Velocity of the shell. If vexp is not given in the reference it is calculated.

column.name: veloc_blue
column.description: Velocity of the blue-shifted maser peak. For single-peak masers it contains the line velocity.

column.name: veloc_red
column.description: Velocity of the red-shifted maser peak in km/s. It contains the line velocity for a single peak maser if it corresponds to the red-shifted peak in other observations.

column.name: veloc_central
column.description: Radial velocity of the central star. If veloc_central is not given in the reference, it is calculated.

column.name: veloc_err
column.description: Uncertainty of velocity values. Taken from the velocity resolution of the observation. It is actually a lower limit of the uncertainty, because the lines are usually much broader than velocity resolution of the observing equipment.

column.name: flux_dens_blue
column.description: Flux Density of the blue-shifted maser peak. For single-peak masers it contains its flux density.

column.name: flux_dens_red
column.description: Flux Density of the red-shifted maser peak. It contains the flux density for a single peak maser, if it corresponds to the red-shifted peak in other observations.

column.name: flux_dens_flag
column.description: NULL -- flux density columns contain detections; < -- non-detection at level flux density blue (3 sigma); > -- flux density blue contains a lower limit for the flux; = -- source only gives fluxes; . -- flux density blue contains probable detection; : -- flux density red contains probable detection; & -- both flux densities contain probable detections

column.name: int_flux_red
column.description: Integrated flux of red peak

column.name: int_flux_blue
column.description: Integrated flux of blue peak

column.name: ref_key
column.description: Internal key for the originating paper, see ohmasers.bibrefs.

column.name: rapub
column.description: RA of object, from source

column.name: depub
column.description: Dec of object, from source

column.description: Selected best RA, J2000

column.name: dej2000
column.description: Selected best Dec, J2000

column.name: mapurl
column.description: URL to information on an interferometric followup observation for this object.

column.name: monitorurl
column.description: URL to information on a monitor programme for this object.
